alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Douglas; Macon; Piatt (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 7:40PM CDT until March 31 at 8:15PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: The National Weather Service in Lincoln has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Piatt County in central Illinois... Southwestern Champaign County in east central Illinois... Northwestern Douglas County in east central Illinois... East central Macon County in central Illinois... * Until 815 PM CDT. * At 739 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located over rural Piatt County, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect considerable tree damage. Damage is likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Bondville around 745 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Bement. This includes the following highways... Interstate 72 between mile markers 148 and 181. Interstate 74 near mile marker 178. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for east central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for central Illinois. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for east central Illinois.
